page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY CONTINUED
page.content:
20th Century The Great Western Railway built a line from Birmingham to Stratford-upon-Avon by 1911.
LOCAL HISTORY OF A PUPIL'S FAMILY. "My school is Mill Lodge in Aqueduct Road in Shirley.Long before the school and houses were built my great great grandfather lived at Brook Farm on Green Lane.It was there before the railway was cut.He worked on the farm and kept cows and took the milk they produced around the countryside in a cart pulled by a horse.My grandmother spent her childhood there.There were only a few houses then and they had to walk to Shirley to do the shopping.The baker,the coalman and the paraffin man came to sell at the door.The entrance area of our school was the blacksmith's known as "Bumper Roberts"
